mods.abstract: Mosque minaret of Shaykh Al-Burdayni (1616-1629), an Islamic Shafilite Egyptian. The mosque was completed in 1694 by a wealthy merchant. The minaret is characteristic of the Mamluk, a revivial of the Quait-Bey period. "Mosquee Kait-Bey a Kabaat-el-Kepchee (Minaret) 44" on print at bottom right side; "J.P. Sebah" below.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
